channel.title: Inspecting Code

item.title: Inspecting Code
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

You should have told them that this can be stored into an array.

public void getTotalLevel() { if(playerRights >= 2) return; int a0 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]); int a1 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]); int a2 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]); int a3 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]); int a4 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]); int a5 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]); int a6 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[6]); int a7 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[7]); int a8 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[8]); int a9 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[9]); int a10 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[10]); int a11 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[11]); int a12 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[12]); int a13 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[13]); int a14 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[14]); int a15 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[15]); int a16 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[16]); int a17 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[17]); int a18 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[18]); int a19 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[19]); int a20 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]); int a21 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[21]); total = a0+a1+a2+a3+a4+a5+a6+a7+a8+a9+a10+a11+a12+a13+a14+a15+a16+a17+a18+a19+a20; sendQuest("Total Lvl: "+total+"", 3984);

Edit: Just found out that this isn’t your work. I was beginning to think you were dumb, sorry. I really want more tutorials trying to teach java basics, but I don’t think this will do.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Whackatre, post:42, topic:436712”][quote author=Serravalle link=topic=539429.msg4024030#msg4024030 date=1340215281]
I stopped reading here

public void getTotalLevel() { if(playerRights >= 2) return; int a0 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]); int a1 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]); int a2 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]); int a3 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]); int a4 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]); int a5 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]); int a6 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[6]); int a7 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[7]); int a8 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[8]); int a9 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[9]); int a10 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[10]); int a11 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[11]); int a12 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[12]); int a13 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[13]); int a14 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[14]); int a15 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[15]); int a16 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[16]); int a17 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[17]); int a18 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[18]); int a19 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[19]); int a20 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]); int a21 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[21]); total = a0+a1+a2+a3+a4+a5+a6+a7+a8+a9+a10+a11+a12+a13+a14+a15+a16+a17+a18+a19+a20; sendQuest("Total Lvl: "+total+"", 3984); }

Why would you not shorten that with a for loop? That’s really big and redundant. Otherwise, good tutorial.
[/quote]

That’s not his code. This tutorial’s purpose was to analyze code, not to improve it.[/quote]
Thank you. I just got the original PI source and looked around for some things to mention :P.

Read full topic

item.title: Inspecting Code
item.dc:creator: @Wank Broham
item.description:
@Wank wrote:

I stopped reading here

public void getTotalLevel() { if(playerRights >= 2) return; int a0 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]); int a1 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]); int a2 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]); int a3 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]); int a4 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]); int a5 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]); int a6 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[6]); int a7 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[7]); int a8 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[8]); int a9 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[9]); int a10 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[10]); int a11 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[11]); int a12 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[12]); int a13 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[13]); int a14 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[14]); int a15 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[15]); int a16 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[16]); int a17 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[17]); int a18 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[18]); int a19 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[19]); int a20 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]); int a21 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[21]); total = a0+a1+a2+a3+a4+a5+a6+a7+a8+a9+a10+a11+a12+a13+a14+a15+a16+a17+a18+a19+a20; sendQuest("Total Lvl: "+total+"", 3984); }

Why would you not shorten that with a for loop? That’s really big and redundant. Otherwise, good tutorial.

item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

JavaTC:

I don’t really get why people get so aroused when someone posts code that’s either long or not organized properly. I know the feeling, but as long as it works without allocating extra resources, then it’s fine.

Because for many, it’s fun to bash on others because their code is longer than yours.

item.title: Inspecting Code
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“kingman002, post:25, topic:436712”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=539429.msg4000472#msg4000472 date=1337913215]
your little

public void getTotalLevel() { if(playerRights >= 2) return; int a0 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]); int a1 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]); int a2 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]); int a3 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]); int a4 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]); int a5 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]); int a6 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[6]); int a7 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[7]); int a8 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[8]); int a9 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[9]); int a10 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[10]); int a11 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[11]); int a12 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[12]); int a13 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[13]); int a14 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[14]); int a15 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[15]); int a16 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[16]); int a17 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[17]); int a18 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[18]); int a19 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[19]); int a20 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]); int a21 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[21]); total = a0+a1+a2+a3+a4+a5+a6+a7+a8+a9+a10+a11+a12+a13+a14+a15+a16+a17+a18+a19+a20; sendQuest("Total Lvl: "+total+"", 3984); }
can be simplified into

public void getTotalLevel() { if(playerRights >= 2) return; int total = 0; for(int i =0; i <= 20; i++) { total += getLevelForXP(playerXP[i]); } sendQuest("Total Lvl: "+total, 3984); }
[/quote]
So true.

But good tutorial anyways Arham. I learned a little bit, but most of this I already knew.[/quote]

getLvlForXP

could be improved all around, it’s just a really shitty thing.

Read full topic
